intro: Phacelia filiae, commonly known as the filial phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks. Phacelia filiae is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting pollinator populations.
